pr_title: Add support to the installed cross-compiler for RISCV

timeline.bodyText: Rather than remove this, I suggest it should supply a default.
timeline.author: keithc-ca
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -22,9 +22,6 @@
 
 include $(CONFIG_INCL_DIR)/configure_common.mk
 
-# The riscv64 cross toolchain is used for both 32bit and 64bit
-RISCV_CROSSTOOLS_PREFIX=riscv64-unknown-linux-gnu

replies.bodyText:
The default value of  RISCV_CROSSTOOLS_PREFIX is set up at ibmruntimes/openj9-openjdk-jdk11#297 as follows:
    ifeq (install,$(RISCV_TOOLCHAIN_TYPE))
      export RISCV_CROSSTOOLS_PREFIX := riscv64-linux-gnu
    else
      export RISCV_CROSSTOOLS_PREFIX := riscv64-unknown-linux-gnu
    endif
replies.author: ChengJin01

replies.bodyText: As discussed with @keithc-ca offline, changed the script to set the default value of RISCV_CROSSTOOLS_PREFIX if not set up in OpenJDK.
replies.author: ChengJin01

timeline.message:
Add support to the installed cross-compiler for RISCV

The change is to ensure the installed cross-compiler
is correctly set up on the host system from OpenJ9
perspective by changing the prefix of the cross-toolchain
if users prefer the installed cross-compiler rather than
building a cross-compiler from the source.

Issue: #7421

Signed-off-by: Cheng Jin <jincheng@ca.ibm.com>
